header.title: Celestial Jinn of the Zodiacal Degrees, Jinn Physician, Jinn Sages, and Talisman for Guided Dreams
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Grimoire Tradition, Jinn Magic, Astromancy, Dream Magic, Healing Magic

central_thesis: This document introduces a potent system of stellar magic involving Celestial Jinn associated with Zodiacal degrees, and outlines specific rituals for invoking Jinn Physicians, Jinn Sages, and a Jinn for guided dreams, emphasizing practical application, dedication, and knowledge of astrological correspondences for effective operation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Celestial Jinn of the Zodiacal Degrees
structure_content.summary: This section introduces a system where specific Jinn are associated with each degree of the Zodiac. It highlights the necessity of dedicated practice and astrological knowledge (planetary rulers, exaltations, natal charts, aspects) to identify the appropriate Jinn for various life situations. It provides a daily exercise involving chanting Tahateel names and the Jinn's name while holding a talismanic square, with an example conjuration for Mercury in Aries. The importance of a dedicated working space, basic protection, prayers, and consecrated talismans is stressed for successful operations.

This section introduces Yonas, a renowned Jinn physician known for healing gynecological issues, pregnancy complications, skin diseases, and various forms of cancer, also famed for herbology. A detailed ritual for his evocation is provided, including dietary restrictions (vegan, daytime fasting), precise timing (first Sunday of new lunar month, beginning at sunrise with operations at midnight), and strict maintenance of physical purity. The core of the ritual involves creating an effigy from specific materials (unlined red paper or cloth), inscribing it with particular Arabic words/symbols on designated body parts using spiritual ink, and hanging it from a pomegranate stick tripod over a brass/tin dish of water. The ritual culminates in repeated conjurations, prayers, and establishing a covenant with Yonas.

This section describes two Jinn Sages, Faqtash and Abba Yazeed, who can impart magical knowledge and education. Separate invocation rituals are outlined for each. For Faqtash, the practice involves performing a ritual under an open, dark sky during the second half of the month, burning bdellium incense, and reciting a specific conjuration 1000 times. For Abba Yazeed, the ritual requires steps similar to Yonas's retreat, involving 21 recitations of a specific conjuration after daily prayers, using a blend of Frankincense, Aloes, and Cilantro as incense, and preparing green palm leaves for the covenant. Both rituals focus on engaging the Jinn for magical instruction and assistance.

This section presents a method for beginners to achieve direct contact with Jinn through dreams, offering a simpler alternative to physical evocation. The process involves a basic ritual purification before sleep, drawing specific symbols on the right hand with the left hand, and reciting the Berhatiah conjuration seven times to invoke the Jinn associated with these symbols. The practitioner must clearly state their question, place the inscribed right palm under their right cheek, and maintain focus on the request while falling asleep. This dream incubation technique can be repeated for up to seven nights until the desired answer or guidance is received.

key_concepts.definition: Spiritual entities associated with specific Zodiacal degrees, capable of being invoked for various purposes, often requiring precise astrological timing and conjuration.
Each degree of the Zodiac is linked to a corresponding Jinn, allowing for precise targeting of magical operations based on astrological charts and planetary positions.

An essential discipline for identifying the correct Jinn and timing rituals, linking astrological principles (planetary rulers, exaltations, natal charts, aspects) to Jinn invocation for optimal effect.
Unique magical squares used in conjunction with chanting Jinn names, often held to channel their energy and serve as a focal point for invocation.
A potent conjuration recommended to boost Jinn evocation, specifically for Jinn Sages and the Talisman for Guided Dreams, indicating its significance in strengthening invocations.
A specific Jinn renowned for healing various ailments, including gynecological problems, skin diseases, and cancer, invoked through a detailed effigy ritual.
Specific Jinn capable of imparting magical knowledge and assistance, accessed through dedicated conjurations and ritual retreats designed for magical education.
A method of receiving direct guidance or knowledge from Jinn by invoking them into one's dreams, typically using a hand talisman, offering an alternative to physical evocation for beginners.
Special ink required for inscribing talismans and effigy symbols, vital for the magical efficacy of written ritual components.
Specific names chanted for planets as part of the daily Jinn invocation exercise, usually in conjunction with Jinn names and talismanic squares.

practical_system.description: The system involves invoking Celestial Jinn associated with Zodiacal degrees, Jinn Physicians, Jinn Sages, and Jinn for guided dreams. It heavily relies on astrological correspondences, precise timing, chanting specific names (Tahateel, Jinn names, Divine names), and creating/using talismans or effigies. It aims for direct interaction and guidance from Jinn for practical life improvements, magical development, and problem-solving through dreams.
tools: Talismanic squares (unique for each Zodiacal degree Jinn)
Effigy of humanoid figure (unlined red paper or cloth)
Frankincense, Aloes, dried cilantro incense (for Abba Yazeed)
Mattress (for rest during Jinn Physician ritual)
rituals: Daily Zodiacal Jinn Practice: Erect a chart for current date, time, and location; locate degrees for each of the seven primary planets. Chant the Tahateel name for each planet (21 times). Follow with chanting the corresponding Jinn's name (54 times) while holding its talismanic square, then make a request within the planet's sphere of influence.

Jinn Physician (Yonas) Evocation: Observe a vegan diet and fast during the day. Start the ritual on the first Sunday of the new lunar month, beginning at sunrise. Maintain physical cleanliness and purity. Perform 'resident release' and erect shielding. Recite the conjuration seven times with the various movements of the Sun (following Islamic prayer times). Perform main operations at midnight. Create an effigy of a humanoid figure from unlined red paper or cloth, writing specific Arabic words on its head ('Mahraqush'), chest ('Taqtaqush'), right hand ('Taresh'), left hand ('Qaresh'), stomach ('Haresh'), right leg (''jalush'), and left leg ('Kardush') using spiritual ink. Hang the effigy upside down from a tripod of three pomegranate sticks wrapped in red cord, placed over a brass/tin dish filled with water. Recite prayers (Salat with two ruka' for Muslims) and blessings on the prophet Mohammed (100 times). Recite the conjuration 21 times, focusing on the dish. Greet Yonas, confirm identity, inquire about function/role, and negotiate a covenant. Release the visitor (3-7 times). Incense: Frankincense, Benzoin, Sandrac, and Aloeswood.

Jinn Sage (Faqtash) Evocation: Must be performed during the second half of the lunar month. Go out under an open sky on a dark night. Burn bdellium incense. Recite the conjuration 'Abrahil yutash barhamisha barhayash. Ya shaltamurash kayhamurash 'abrashitha malakhiya. Respond, O lord Jalil Tahitam'iliyal, and order Faqtash to come and accomplish my need. Hurry, hurry! Quick, quick! Now, now!' 1000 times. Greet him without fear, state your request, and accept his conditions for assistance.

Jinn Sage (Abba Yazeed) Evocation: Follow similar retreat steps as for Yonas. Recite the conjuration 'By the name of the Divine who created, nurtured, and bloomed the trees; by He who brought forth the water from between the stones; by He who moves the constellations and stars; by He who possess the angels and subjugate them and thus they commanded, brought, and burned each rebellious spirit that doesn’t believe in the day of measure. By the name of the Divine the magnificent majesty, Lord of the Elders, the power, and awe, I adjure you O Abba Yazeed the sage to answer and come and listen to my adjuration. Come from every depth for if the Divine willed He enabled you then path made it easy for you. I adjure you by He who is the One, the Alone, the Singularity, the Eternal who hasn’t been born and possess no offsprings and none is like unto Him. By Hohen Hohen Ah Ehieh Asher Ehieh Adonai Tzabbaoth El Shaddi come to me O Abba Yazeed the sage. Hurry, hurry! Quick, quick! Now, now!' 21 times after each daily prayer (timed with the Sun's movement). Incense: Frankincense, Aloes, and dried cilantro. Prepare a large piece of green palm leaves for the covenant. He will give a ring/seal and shielding in return.

Talisman for Guided Dreams: Perform a basic ritual purification before going to bed. Write specific symbols on your right hand using your left hand. Recite the Berhatiah conjuration seven times, asking the Jinn associated with the symbols on your hand to come into your dream and provide an answer. State your question very clearly. Place your right palm underneath your right cheek and fall asleep on your side, maintaining focus on your request. Repeat the process for up to seven days if needed until the answer is received.

relevant_quotes.text: You are looking right now at a huge chunk of a potent system of stellar magic. When I first started working on this report my goal was to give you only the list of the names of the Jinn connected to the degrees of the Zodiac with basic numerical magic squares. However, the system and the material are so important that I opted to lift the veil on more than the basics.
I am genuinely offering you something that can make your daily living easier and unlike pots and pans it literally is a once in a life-time acquisition.

This system likewise benefits tremendously from any practical experiences you might have with planetary magic. However, it functions differently in that it works with a class of celestial jinn. To use martial terms, you would benefit from going to the gym and learning self-defense classes, but this system is more like hiring your own Chuck Norris for a mission.
You don’t need complex analysis of a chart. You just need a table of the planets and their degrees.
I would advice you to do all seven planets each day for at least 40 days and then look at the results. Note your experiences or any dreams you may have had.
A Jinn physician can play a preventive role and not just an instructive role. They can sometime tell you before you fall sick what you may very well contract down the road.
The words al-Najem al-Thaqeb translates to piercing star in Arabic.

The original instructions require a clean and unused dish made from brass and tin. This dish is filled with water ¾ of the ways. It is placed in front of you. Over the dish is a tripod made of three pomegranate sticks wrapped together with red cord. Note that red cord indicate underworld workings, while green cord indicate upper jinn working. Obviously, the original instruction relied on a more underworld approach.

Often people struggle to attain contact with the Jinn on a physical level. It is of course feasible, but for a beginner in the art a more simpler approach can come in hand. This is the realm of the dream.

critical_analysis.relevance: The text presents a practical grimoire-style approach to Jinn magic, emphasizing precise astrological timing and specific conjurations for diverse purposes (general stellar influence, healing, magical education, dream guidance). It directly addresses common magical needs (love, wealth, revenge, healing, knowledge) and positions Jinn as accessible, albeit powerful, entities for direct interaction. The system's relevance lies in its direct instructions for operative magic, moving beyond theoretical discussions to actionable steps for practitioners. It attempts to demystify Jinn interaction by providing structured methods.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of intermediate to advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism who possess a foundational understanding of planetary magic, basic astrology (planetary degrees), and ritualistic practice (purification, shielding, basic evocation concepts). The author's references to 'Magic That Works' and 'Ring of Solomon' as beneficial prerequisites indicate a readership already engaged with similar traditions. This work is not suitable for absolute beginners, as it assumes prior knowledge of 'basic protection and shielding tools and methods' and 'effective conjuration.'
